comments:
I have a lot of log error about launch configurations that are not found 
anymore because of 2 things:

1> The plugin that provided the launch is removed

2> The project that had that configuration is closed.

if it was me then launch configurations of removed plugins should be removed 
silently. 

For project launch configurations is it not better to listen to project open 
en close events? So with open you look for launch configuration in that just 
openend project and with closed for launch configs that are affected and 
remove them.

the 2 stacktraces: (first one plugin)

I'm going to defer this one. The exception is handled and processing continues, 
so there is nothing critical here (except message in the log).

The issue is that we lazily load launch configs (for efficiency), rather than 
pre-loading them at startup. Thus, each client would have to deal with the 
specific error, and perform clean-up. At this point, we do not want to change 
the debug core startup to pre-validate launch configs.

Deferred for post 2.1 consideration

Fixed in LaunchConfigurationManger. Simply removed error logging from 
#isVisible - it is not neccessary.

traces.message: Launch configuration type  id "jmechanic.eclipse.profiler.launchconfig" does not exist. Possible causes:  Missing specification of a launch type (missing plugin)  Incorrect launch configuration XML
